original_solution_mapping.L1: If Alex has 4 pens in the first week of a month, she will have 4*2 = <<4*2=8>>8 pens in the second week.
original_solution_mapping.L2: After her pen collection doubles in the third week, Alex will have 2*8 = <<2*8=16>>16 pens.
original_solution_mapping.L3: In the last week of the month, Alex will have 2*16 = <<2*16=32>>32 pens after her pen collection.
original_solution_mapping.L4: If Jane has 16 pens after a month, Alex will have 32-16 = <<32-16=16>>16 more pens than Jane.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3555.
    Returns: how many more pens Alex will have than Jane after a month.
    """
    # L1
    alex_pens_week1 = 4 # Alex has 4 pens in the first week
    doubling_factor = 2 # pen collection doubles
    alex_pens_week2 = alex_pens_week1 * doubling_factor

    # L2
    alex_pens_week3 = doubling_factor * alex_pens_week2

    # L3
    alex_pens_week4 = doubling_factor * alex_pens_week3

    # L4
    jane_pens_after_month = 16 # Jane will have 16 pens after a month
    alex_more_than_jane = alex_pens_week4 - jane_pens_after_month

    # FA
    answer = alex_more_than_jane
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If Alex has {alex_pens_week1} pens in the first week of a month, she will have {alex_pens_week1}*{doubling_factor} = <<{alex_pens_week1}*{doubling_factor}={alex_pens_week2}>>{alex_pens_week2} pens in the second week.
After her pen collection doubles in the third week, Alex will have {doubling_factor}*{alex_pens_week2} = <<{doubling_factor}*{alex_pens_week2}={alex_pens_week3}>>{alex_pens_week3} pens.
In the last week of the month, Alex will have {doubling_factor}*{alex_pens_week3} = <<{doubling_factor}*{alex_pens_week3}={alex_pens_week4}>>{alex_pens_week4} pens after her pen collection.

If Jane has {jane_pens_after_month} pens after a month, Alex will have {alex_pens_week4}-{jane_pens_after_month} = <<{alex_pens_week4}-{jane_pens_after_month}={alex_more_than_jane}>>{alex_more_than_jane} more pens than Jane.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If Alex has 4 pens in the first week of a month, she will have 4*2 = <<4*2=8>>8 pens in the second week.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: After her pen collection doubles in the third week, Alex will have 2*8 = <<2*8=16>>16 pens.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: In the last week of the month, Alex will have 2*16 = <<2*16=32>>32 pens after her pen collection.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: If Jane has 4 pens after a month, Alex will have 32-4 = <<32-4=28>>28 more pens than Jane.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'alex_pens_week1' (4) was used instead of 'jane_pens_after_month' (16).
